# Professional Audit Support Services (PASS) - External Audit Stream 5

## Solicitation Summary

The Government of Canada is soliciting bids for a Professional Audit Support Services (PASS) contract to provide audit support for the Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) operations under the External Audit Stream 5. The contract will be awarded to a qualified supply arrangement holder who can provide services in the National Capital Region.

## Description of Requirements

The PWGSC is seeking a licensed public accounting firm to conduct the annual financial attest audit of the Financial Report of Administrative Costs Charged to the Canada Pension Plan Account. The services will include expressing an opinion on the fairness of information contained in the financial report and providing an in-depth knowledge of auditing standards and principles.

## Period of Performance

The period of performance for the contract is from the date of contract award to December 31, 2024, inclusive. The government reserves the right to extend the contract term for up to 4 additional one-year periods.

## Security Requirements

The contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and Document Safeguarding Capability at the level of PROTECTED B, issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP). The contractor's personnel must also hold a valid Reliability status granted or approved by the CSP.

## Tender Procedure

The tender procedure will be a selective tendering process, where pre-qualified suppliers will be invited to bid on the requirement. The pre-qualified suppliers are:

* Aniko Consultants Inc.
* BDO Canada LLP
* Deloitte LLP
* Ernst & Young LLP
* KPMG LLP
* MNP LLP
* Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP
* Raymond Chabot Grant Thornton Consulting Inc.
* Samson & Associes-CPA Consultation Inc.
* Welch LLP.

## Method of Supply

The PASS method of supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles. The Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) solicitation for the PASS quarterly refreshes is posted on the CanadaBuys website.

**Important Information**

* The contract will be awarded to a qualified supply arrangement holder who can provide services in the National Capital Region.
* The contractor must meet the security requirements outlined above.
* The services will include expressing an opinion on the fairness of information contained in the financial report and providing an in-depth knowledge of auditing standards and principles.
* The contract period of performance is from the date of contract award to December 31, 2024, inclusive.
